title: Bug 49235: ServletContainerInitializer onStartup(Set<Class<? classSet is not expecting class
description: Bug 49235: When calling the onStartup method of the ServletContainerInitializer class, the output is 'MySomeClass' instead of 'MySomeAnn'.
OB: The onStartup method of the ServletContainerInitializer class is printing 'MySomeClass' instead of the expected 'MySomeAnn' when iterating over the classSet.
EB: The onStartup method of the ServletContainerInitializer class should print 'MySomeAnn' when iterating over the classSet.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Build Tomcat 7.0.0 from SVN r939221.
2. Implement the MySomeClass and MySomeAnn classes.
3. Implement the ModuleInitializer class that extends ServletContainerInitializer and overrides the onStartup method.
4. Call the onStartup method passing a classSet with the MySomeAnn class.
5. Observe that the output is 'MySomeClass' instead of 'MySomeAnn'.
